a: You can travel using metro, buses, trams, app-based taxis and auto-rickshaws. Metro is the fastest way across the city.
Winter months, from November to February, are ideal for visiting Kolkata — pleasant weather and many cultural events.
Roshogolla, Mishti Doi, Kathi Rolls, and Puchka are iconic Kolkata dishes loved by everyone!
Victoria Memorial is located in central Kolkata, near the Maidan area. It’s open daily except Monday.
Bengali is the main language, but Hindi and English are also commonly spoken.
The Howrah Bridge, officially Rabindra Setu, connects Kolkata and Howrah over the Hooghly River. It’s an engineering marvel.
Durga Puja, Kali Puja, and Saraswati Puja are the biggest festivals celebrated with grandeur.
Kolkata has a tropical climate — hot summers (April-June), monsoon rains (July-September), and pleasant winters (Nov-Feb).
Victoria Memorial, Howrah Bridge, Dakshineswar Temple, Indian Museum, and Park Street are top attractions.
Try roshogolla, sandesh, mishti doi, and chomchom — local favorites found at KC Das, Balaram Mullick, and Bhim Chandra Nag.
